result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donald Michael Trepania Jr.

Attny Forseth to file bond motion, and hearing will be set.   Court sets status hearing.  Bond Continues.

11:02 AM Defendant Donald Michael Trepania in court with attorney Robert N Forseth appears by video.  Jennifer Gross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court calls case and recites appearances. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.  Court reinstate SIBS $1500.   Through Attny DEF waives time limits for preliminary hearing.    Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.  Status conference scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

9:13AM Defendant Donald Michael Trepania not in court.  Attorney Robert N Forseth in court, appearing by video.   Jennifer Gross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Atty Forseth indicates he has been unable to reach DEF.    State requests warrant for Sawyer and surrounding counties and bail forfeiture proceedings.   Court grants request.  Warrant authorized as requested and bail forfeiture to begin.  Bail/Bond Review scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843.
